Description: Ostracon, small fragment of the body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the exterior, now obscured by an off-white deposit, is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of a number of lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394548) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394548)
